unit_designation: 47° Gruppo Caccia (later 47° Gruppo BT - Bombardamento Terrestre)
research_brief_status: UNIT NOT PRESENT IN NORTH AFRICA DURING THIS QUARTER
historical_discrepancy: Seed file claims 1942-Q2 deployment during Battle of Gazala (May-June 1942), but historical sources document first North Africa deployment on 28 August 1942 (1942-Q3)

sources.evidence: Deployment table shows: April 1941 at Vicenza; May 1941 joined 15° Stormo Assalto with CR.42; 28 August 1942 FIRST deployment to Benghasi K.1
28 August 1942: Moved from Italy to Benghasi K.1 for first North Africa combat operations

movements.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein operations

sources.evidence: Complete deployment timeline showing all North Africa bases from August 1942 through May 1943 surrender

battle_of_gazala_participation.47_gruppo_status: NOT PRESENT - Unit still training in Italy at Vicenza
battle_of_gazala_participation.evidence: No mention of 47° Gruppo in Gazala order of battle. Unit's first North Africa deployment occurred 2 months AFTER Gazala concluded.
other_15_stormo_units_at_gazala: 50° Gruppo Caccia (deployed at various Libyan bases)
NOTE: 47° Gruppo was NOT part of these Gazala operations

unit_history_context.may_1941: Joined 15° Stormo Assalto, re-equipped with CR.42 for ground attack role
unit_history_context.april_1942_june_1942: Training and work-up operations in Italy (DURING BATTLE OF GAZALA)
unit_history_context.august_1942: FIRST deployment to North Africa (Benghasi K.1)
unit_history_context.september_1942_may_1943: Combat operations in North Africa through final surrender

seed_data_correction.recommendation: Remove 47° Gruppo Caccia from 1942-Q2 seed data. Add to 1942-Q3 and subsequent quarters through 1943-Q2 (surrender in Tunisia, May 1943).

commander.name: Commander not identified for 1942-Q2 (unit was in Italy)
commander.note: Unit was not in North Africa during this quarter

personnel.note: Unit was not present in North Africa during 1942-Q2

aircraft.note: Unit's aircraft (CR.42AS) were in Italy during 1942-Q2, not North Africa

supply_logistics.supply_status: NOT APPLICABLE - Unit not deployed to North Africa in 1942-Q2

weather_environment.terrain_type: NOT APPLICABLE - Unit was in Italy

source: Cross-reference with 15° Stormo Assalto unit history
Battle of Gazala order of battle (May-June 1942) - 47° Gruppo not listed

all_fields.reason: Unit was not present in North Africa during 1942-Q2. Historical evidence shows first deployment on 28 August 1942 (1942-Q3), two months after Battle of Gazala concluded.
sources_checked: Battle of Gazala orders of battle
Italian Air Force North Africa deployment records
all_fields.mitigation: Extract 47° Gruppo Caccia for 1942-Q3 (first deployment August 28) and subsequent quarters through 1943-Q2 (Tunisia surrender May 1943). Remove from 1942-Q2 seed data.

notes: SEED FILE ERROR: 47° Gruppo Caccia was NOT in North Africa during 1942-Q2
Unit was training in Italy at Vicenza during Battle of Gazala (May-June 1942)
First North Africa deployment: 28 August 1942 at Benghasi K.1 (1942-Q3)
Actual North Africa service: August 1942 - May 1943 (9 months)
Recommendation: Remove from 1942-Q2, add to 1942-Q3 through 1943-Q2

immediate_actions: Remove 47° Gruppo Caccia from 1942-Q2 seed file
Add 47° Gruppo Caccia to 1942-Q3 seed file (first deployment: 28 August 1942)

future_extraction_quarters.operations: Withdrawal operations after Second El Alamein

related_units: 46° Gruppo Caccia (same 15° Stormo, WAS present at Gazala in 1942-Q2)

metadata.reason_for_brief: Seed file incorrectly lists 47° Gruppo Caccia as present in North Africa during 1942-Q2 (Battle of Gazala period). Historical evidence conclusively shows unit was training in Italy and did not deploy to North Africa until 28 August 1942 (1942-Q3).
metadata.sources_quality: Tier 2 (Asisbiz.com with detailed deployment tables and dates)
